items.q: Fill in the blank: There are ___ students in class today than yesterday.
Fill in the blank: I need to drink ___ sugar in my tea.
Choose the sentence that uses 'fewer' correctly.
options: I have fewer free time this week.
We made fewer mistakes on the second test.
There is fewer water in the bottle.

items.q: Choose the sentence that uses 'less' correctly.
options: There are less cars on the road today.
He made less errors than before.
We have less time to finish the project.
I have less books than you.

items.q: Identify the sentence with the error.
options: Fewer people attended the meeting this week.
We need less noise in the library.
She has fewer responsibilities in her new job.
There are less chairs in this room than before.

items.q: Fill in the blanks: 'We want ___ interruptions and ___ emails each day.'
Choose the best option: 'If we make ___ mistakes, we will have ___ problems.'
Which explanation correctly describes 'fewer' vs 'less'?
options: 'Fewer' is for uncountable nouns; 'less' is for countable nouns.
'Fewer' is for countable nouns; 'less' is for uncountable nouns.
'Less' is more formal and always preferred.

items.q: Fill in the blank: There is ___ water in the glass than before.
Fill in the blank: We saw ___ tourists this year than last year.
Identify the sentence that is completely correct.
options: We had less people at the event this time.
We had fewer people and less noise at the event this time.
We had fewer people and fewer noise at the event this time.
We had less people and fewer noise at the event this time.

items.q: Choose the sentence with the mistake.
options: I spend less money on snacks now.
We faced fewer problems than expected.
There is less pollution in this area.
He has fewer experience than his colleague.

items.q: Fill in the blanks: 'The new system uses ___ energy and causes ___ errors.'
Choose the sentence that follows the traditional rule.
options: There were less than ten students in the room.
She ate fewer than half the cake.
He has fewer than five years of experience.
We waited for fewer than an hour.

items.q: Choose the sentence that is completely correct.
options: We have less than an hour to finish.
We have fewer than an hour to finish.

items.q: Identify the sentence that is completely correct.
options: There are fewer cars and less traffic today.
There are less cars and fewer traffic today.
There are fewer cars and fewer traffic today.
There are less cars and less traffic today.

items.q: Fill in the blank: 'We need to spend ___ time arguing and ___ time working.'
Which guideline is most accurate in careful written English?
options: Always use 'less' for anything involving numbers.
Use 'fewer' with things you can count and 'less' with things you cannot easily count.
Use 'less' only with time and money.

items.q: In the sentence 'We saw fewer stars because there was less light pollution', which word modifies a countable noun?
